Reviews.Title: “Good if you need this location”
Reviews.Author: bowwowwow
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was close to relatives and I wish we stayed downtown or Old Montreal. This place is located on a sort of express way surrounded by parking lot. (complimentary tfor guests). the hotel rambles on and on so you can be located a long long walk.from the lobby. We used an alternate elevator to save steps but it was shabby and unappealing. The shower "head" was detachable which was actually nice, But.. when you turned off the water, the change in pressure caused it to fall out of its holder. One time this broke a glass in the shower. the room was spacious but the beds a little too soft. So, all in all just acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, great uptown location”
Reviews.Author: Vacationer0052
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been around for some time, but the rooms in the 'tower' section are in good shape. The rooms are spacious, with all the necessary amenities and clean, newer bathrooms. Free parking. Attentive staff that aims to please. I have allergies, and this hotel actually listened, removing all of those pesky feathers and woolly items from our room, just as we had requested. And they did it all with a smile. Coffee shop has an adequate breakfast buffet for $6.95. The hotel is located a couple of blocks from the Metro, and close to Hampstead, Cote St Luc and Snowdon areas of town. A very pleasant place to stay. We had avoided it after staying in an old musty room in the lowrise section. But now we will return to a room in the tower, and recommend it to others too. Well equipped gym open 24/7.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel-No problems”
Reviews.Author: MellynnNc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ruby Fooâ€™s on a recent business trip and found the property to be a clean and comfortable, although possibly more for business travel. It is reasonably priced, free wifi and is located within a short walk (about 5 minutes) of the Metro. The two restaurants offer adequate food for quick meals. I would not consider this a hotel for travelers who wish to be â€œwithin the cityâ€� but, as I stated above, the metro is close should you wish to venture into the city. The rooms are decorated with an Asian flair and the bedding is very comfortable with nice large, full pillows. The staff was accommodating and friendly. The maid service was excellent. I would stay at this property again should be in the district on business.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you over look the burn holes and hairs”
Reviews.Author: OysterLove
Reviews.Content: Well I hate to sum it up to that, but we rented three rooms for a family event and all three had hairs in the beds and bathrooms, and stains on the robes. One room even had three cigarette burns in the robe despite it being a non-smoking room. It was a budget type hotel, dated and needing a better housekeeping staff, but otherwise OK. Beds were comfy, towels were rough and small, evening desk staff seemed a bit tipsy perhaps?

Reviews.Title: “There are better choices”
Reviews.Author: smokeboy
Reviews.Content: First time we have stayed at this hotel and found it to be OK, but nothing special. Upon arrival, the front desk had no record of our reservation. Showed the front desk clerk my confirmation, but there was no record of me. Got a room which was small, but it was very clean. The furniture was in rough condition, but was adequate. The room was adjoining to the room next door, and for over 1 hour we listened to the telephone conversation of my next door neighbor - word for word! He may as well have been in my room. Also heard him snoring and coughing throughout the night. Thank goodness for earplugs! Stay away from the buffet breakfast. Even at $6.99 it is a rip-off. Tried it on 2 occasions and found no variety, eggs were gone, no yogurt available. All that was available was bacon, cold potatoes, cereal, and some mini muffins. For breakfast walk 100 yards to a restaurant called La Belle Province and have a full breakfast for $5 including tax. Even though we prepaid the breakfast, we went elsewhere to eat on 2 of the 4 mornings we stayed. When we return to Montreal, we will stay somewhere else beccause this hotel was just "adequate"

Reviews.Title: “Great all-around hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Chevelle87
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and comfortable and had a nice asian flair which was enough to be chic without being tacky. Gym was great and staff was friendly and helpful. It's not located downtown, but its less than a 5min walk to Montreal's great subway system so getting around was never an issue. Lots of nearby fast-food choices including the famous Orange Julep! Parking was in front of the hotel and easily accessible which seems minor but is huge for me. Would stay here again when in Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Chinese Flair In French Montreal. Close to NRC Biotechnical Research Institute”
Reviews.Author: Island_Joe095
Reviews.Content: Great chinese hotel in French speaking Montreal. Big room, excellent bedding, great night's sleep. Spent two days and enjoyed both. I have stayed here before and will be back again. Restuarant was a suprise. Had lunch with some locals gals. English, French and Chinese spoken here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, good value”
Reviews.Author: chitowncuse
Reviews.Content: The rooms here are very nice and have some unique decoration. The location is close to a Metro stop, but it is a bit far from downtown.

Reviews.Title: “A+ Starr”
Reviews.Author: Colleen G
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for business. It was an immaculately clean, beautiful room. The staff was very friendly and welcoming. After checking out I realized that I had left my necklace on the bed rather than putting it on. I called the hotel and they quickly found the necklace and FedExd it out to me the same day. As I was traveling on to Toronto after leaving, the necklace arrived back the in US before I did. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: keeperof4
Reviews.Content: Needing accommodations in Montreal for business for two days we again relied on Tripadvisor for advice. Ruby Foo's didn't let us down. We chose this location because of the proximity to where I needed to do business. For the price this was a magnificent find. When we arrived the staff was very pleasant during check in. The room itself (king bed) was very clean and decorated very tastefully. Flat panel tv , free internet , great shower, lots of hot water, mini fridge. They provide robes which was a great bonus for my wife. We chose the first night to eat at their restaurant Mahjongg ,nice atmosphere, pricey. The food ok. The only complaint would be that we had 3 different servers and the price of the non alcoholic drinks was shocking to say the least. Not reccommended if you are on a budget. We had breakfast at the Dlux cafe which was very nice. The breakfast was priced right very well prepared, and the staff very pleasant and prompt in serving our meal. Road construction is on going in the city which makes driving anything but pleasant. A special thank you to the concierge, sorry can't remember his name, he was a blessing in providing us information on how to use the metro to get us to all locations throughout the city. They provide free parking which is also another bonus for the price. I would highly reccommend this hotel for anyone traveling to the area.A kind thank you to all great staff of Ruby Foo's.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 60Grit
Reviews.Content: We started off at a hotel recommended to us that was supposed to be "fantastic, clean and well priced". only to find out it was garbage, they charged me $25 dollars for parking and then couldn't accomodate my SUV, the room smelled and was tiny... We ran out of there!! As an ex Montrealer I knew of Ruby Foos but hadn't been there in 20 years or more. Well without a reservation we showed up there and got a warm welcome, an unbelievable room completely renovated and new, at a beyond great rate. And we were able to enjoy our family vacation. Free parking, great restaurant, close to everything. Just the best place to stay period.

Reviews.Title: “review for restaurant only, not hotel”
Reviews.Author: frog2011
Reviews.Content: We went to Montreal for a one-day trip and we ate lunch in the Ruby Foo's' restaurant, whose name is Mahjongg Bistro de Chine. The waiters are friendly. They help your tea before you ask. The decoration is elegant and the atmosphere is enjoyable. For lunch, they provide dim sum or we can order dishes. The menu of dim sum is in less than 1 page of paper, so we order our own dishes. The dish menu is on the both side of one page of menu. We choose a combination of 3 dishes (your own choice) for around $38. The rib is tasted very good. mushroom is tender. We think it's worth for the price even it's a little bit higher than the regular Chinese restaurant. Overall, I'm satisfy for the lunch and I want to try more. Especially the choice for lunch is limited, we like try some their special dishes for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastSoutherner
Reviews.Content: Our family always chooses Hotel Ruby Foo's. It is clean, close to the Metro, suburbs, and downtown. The rooms are very spacious and the sliding Asian inspired blinds are fabulous. The location is definitely not for those looking to hop out of your hotel and checkout the city... unless you are looking for Harvey's and Walmart... but if you know the city and can navigate around a bit, it's near everything for a great price! Two things I'd recommend to management would be the option for a grab and go coffee/ breakfast place. The sit-down option is very expensive and not very speedy. And, also, train your staff. We were appalled as a bellman watched us drag in all of our stuff without so much as offering a hand. The front desk, as well, were cold and rude. The man at the gas station next door answered more questions.

Reviews.Title: “I was treated like Ruby Foo's family.”
Reviews.Author: MurrayC_11
Reviews.Content: Ruby Foo's holds a special place in my heart. As a child I frequented the original Ruby Foo's Restaurant in the 1960's. The current hotel came later and retains the classy image that the name Ruby Foo's holds dear. I had a wonderful 5 night stay and would want to stay nowhere else on my next trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “A welcome experience”
Reviews.Author: MichGlas
Reviews.Content: If you prefer to stay in midtown Montreal, Ruby Foos is tops.The housekeeping staff did their job well. The front desk staff were all cordial and knowledgable. The pool area and the exercise facilities were well appointed. Room furnishings and decor were very attractive and the bedding was of high quality. We were impressed with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the service”
Reviews.Author: joannec44
Reviews.Content: Our room was lovely and clean.(got some decorating ideas) The staff couldn't have been any nicer. Very informative, if they didn't know they made sure you talked to someone who did. Very pleasant and eager to please. Would stay there again without a doubt. We were there for the U2 concert so it was great, we didn't have to be sardines on the subway after the concert. Just walked back to our room. There was lots of free parking. For the weekend of the concert they even had it paroled by security. We had a wonderful stay Thanks !

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the name fool you! Excellent and modern hotel outside city centre of Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: tracey2586
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel a few days ago whilst on a bus tour to Quebec City. When our tour guide announced the name of this hotel, my husband and I were a little worried. My husband thought it was the name of a brothel and another passenger thought we were being sold as slaves at this establishment. However, we were very surprised when we arrived. Although the hotel isn't in the city centre, it's close to the Metro and is 20 mins away from the centre. The hotel lobby was modern and stylish. When we got to our room it was quite spacious with 2 queen beds and modern decor. Beds and bathroom were very clean! My husband and I wanted to go to the city centre for dinner. The reception was very helpful in giving us directions and gave us a map. Metro (Namur) was about a 2-3 minute walk or less. If you're there in the afternoon/night. Buy the metro ticket that is valid for unlimited trips for the night (only 4CAD). All in all, it was a pleasant surprise! I would definitely stay here again. Only con would be the location if you wanted to stay closer to Vieux Montreal or the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was professional and courteous in time of need”
Reviews.Author: trevster2k
Reviews.Content: I was not a guest at Ruby Foos but stopped by after the first U2 show in Montreal. There was a torrential rainstorm which surprised 80000 people and everyone was cold and wet. People were trapped outside and soaked to the bone. We met friends who were staying at Ruby Foo's. Despite not being guests, the staff provided people who sought refuge from the storm with towels, plastic bags and use of their facilities with no questions asked. I was very impressed with how they handled the situation. No one encouraged people to leave, they answered questions about the road closures, metro and taxi service. I will definitely consider staying at this hotel when considering fine accommodations in Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “300.00 for one nite and it was a very small room”
Reviews.Author: roni055
Reviews.Content: Three hundred dollars plus taxes for 1 nite because U2 was in town I didn't mind considering this was a Luxury Hotel, but we had to wait for a room because they were not ready for us. The restaurant was closed...There was no complimentary anything. It said that WI Fi was free but didnt work properly. The room was small and the bathtub plumbing did not work well as did the toilet. I would not recomend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “re Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: lamby1
Reviews.Content: After an Atlantic flight what a pleasant surprise to find a delightful full service hotel close to the airport (10 Minutes) where the staff were more than helpful. The rooms were large with all the expected facilities and the Asian restaurant exceeded expectation. A great challenge to the multinational chains try it and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful reception”
Reviews.Author: Busytraveller57415
Reviews.Content: Good location. Bright and nicely decorated clean room with quality amenities. King size bed with pillow top mattress and comforter. Pleasant staff. Great Restaurant (Mahjongg) and Coffee shop (dLux) with smiling staff early in the morniing Easy free parking. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly peaceful”
Reviews.Author: Cal_Greg
Reviews.Content: I'd recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a good night's sleep and is looking for good customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel that provides it all!”
Reviews.Author: truffymontreal
Reviews.Content: I had visited this hotel many years ago and thought I would give it another try. The decor has changed dramatically. It has a more modern and quite beautiful decor. The bedroom had a zen look and feel, and the bed gave me one of the most comfortable nights sleep that I have had for some time!! What I really liked is how many services it offered. It has a Spa, hairdresser and an old fashioned type barber shop. The restaurant selection was diversified and I really enjoyed having a Starbucks coffee everyday. I also appreciated the extensive fitness centre that I could go any time since it is open 24 hours a day! We could walk to the subway which is only 1 block away and were also close to shopping and several other restaurants. I will come back to this little gem the next time I need a hotel in Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Ruby rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Massika
Reviews.Content: Â Â After a terrible trip from Toronto, plane delayed, snow storm and for any reason, my reservation in one of the hotels on CÃ´te-de-Liesse was not confirmed, I was sent to Ruby Foo's on Decarie...Â Staff was very welcoming. They gave me one of the nicest rooms I have ever seen for a 4 star hotel. I had a snack in the evening at the restaurant and took the elevator to my room. What can I say about the new rooms? They are beautiful! The ambiance is very peaceful and I love the sliding door which replaces the regular curtains that you can find in most hotels in Montreal. Despite this hotel is located on Decarie, the rooms are very quiet and comfortable. I felt asleep as soon as I lied down and reopened my eyes with the wake up call! Ruby Foo's rocks! I really enjoyed my stay and will come back! Â

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: Drtuuth
Reviews.Content: Had our wedding banquet at the Ruby Foo's last August. What a mistake! Service was rude. Too eager to remove the plates. Barely had the chance to taste half my meal. Even less the cake. The food was not that great. Low on quantity. And the banquet manager....Well, I won't even go there. Pleeeeeeeeease! Don't plan your wedding reception there.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Price”
Reviews.Author: Shamak
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ruby Foos for two weeks due to the compulsion of location otherwise I would have not stayed for such a long period of time. The front desk staff is rude, unskilled and uncooperative. Every day they would call me and ask for payments even though I had pre-authorized my payments. I always found that their staff lacked coordination. One time I had just come up to my room after clearing my payments, I received a call from another staff member who rudely asked me to come down again and pay. When I informed him that I had already paid, he replied with the lame excuse of not "updating" his computer. The room cleaning staff is also rude and are always reluctant to clean and set the whole room. Quite a few times they would not change the bed sheets and not replenish the tea bags/coffee. The hotel has poor architecture making you drag your luggage in long hallways. They do not provide extended check out for even one hour during the off season to a customer who stayed for such an extended period. Shortly, its way too expensive for the services they offer. When you pay such a high price you expect more!!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky Business Hotel with Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: quan_campbell
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the staff very helpful. Breakfast was really good, but make sure to get there at 7am if youâ€™re in a rush. Hotel has a slightly tacky Asian flare, but I thought it was fun. Apparently, there is an old & new wing. Ask for the new wing, as my shower head really didnâ€™t work that well. Location was close to the Metro and the concierge was helpful in picking restaurants & locations for nightlife. It was a short cab ride from the airport (15-20minutes). Thereâ€™s a well stocked bar, 2 restaurants, a decent gym & free wireless. Thereâ€™s also a spa, pool & barber that I didnâ€™t take advantage of.

Reviews.Title: “My Ruby”
Reviews.Author: konkreate
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed stay with Ruby at Montreal.Excellent room decor and facility.Excellent cleanliness.Ruby is very near to Metro station,Walmart and Tim Horton to travel -shop-and eat.On the road and no puzzle to search. I wish I get another chance to Kiss Ruby

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Mingxue
Reviews.Content: this is one hotel that sounds good online but is one of the worse we've stayed at. Actually we didn't end up staying. We checked out the first day and went to stay at a Sheraton nearby. The hotel staff were rude, inpatient and unhelpful. The room they gave us was outdated, not well maintained or felt clean. The walk to the room was through long hallways.Not recommend this place at all.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Standard Rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: jubejube
Reviews.Content: We booked a "standard" room, which looked nice on the hotel website. When we walked into the room, my 13-year old daughter promptly burst into tears and cried "I want to go home!" This room looked like it hadn't been updated since the 1960's. In fact, I'm sure the furniture was that old. For some reason, there was an ironing board set up in the middle of the room. The sliding door to the closet was made of metal with glossy paint on it that was peeled off in a few places, and would barely close. One of the staff we spoke to in the hallway even told us that these old rooms "smell". After discussing the situation with the manager, we were given a renovated room; however, this cost us an extra $27. The renovated room was nice, although small. It was decorated in an oriental theme, with comfortable beds, a large flat screen TV and a mini-fridge. This hotel is located in a rather rundown area of Montreal. In fact, we were confronted by a man in the parking lot late at night who wanted money from us. Since no one else was around, we had no choice but to give it to him to avoid possible violence. Because of the problems we encountered, we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GYK
Reviews.Content: Owing to our plane's delay we didn't arrive to the hotel until after midnight. The receptionist was welcoming, efficient and spoke perfect English. We were given a junior suite which was spacious and with a kitchenette/fridge etc. The hotel's public areas and our room were spotlessly clean and attractive. Attached to the hotel is the D'Lux Cafe/Restaurant where a good choice of meals are served from breakfast through to nighttime. There is also another restaurant where the menu is more expensive and more upmarket. During warmer months the hotel has a good size swimming pool with pool chairs surrounding it. The nearest metro station (Namur) is a 5 minute walk away (on the same side of the road) and from this station you can reach all the main tourist areas without changing trains. The weekend we were in Montreal was the Grande Prix, so the whole city was crowded for the big event. We caught the hop on-hop off bus (with a live commentary) which gave us a good 2 hour tour both in the city and it's surroundings - getting to places we, otherwise, wouldn't have easily reached.. During the summer they have more buses running so the wait is far less - but in the spring and autumn they seem to only have 2 buses so you can wait as long as an hour before the next bus comes along. The hotel is about a 20 minute ride from the main international airport. It is a large hotel and lies back from the busy main road - we couldn't hear any trafic noise in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly, Efficient”
Reviews.Author: dagobert2010
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights with family during Grand Prix weekend. Staff were friendly, took the time to explain things in a patient, professional manner. Rooms as advertised, clean and comfortable. Near the metro which was great for us. Checkout was very efficient, taxi was waiting outside. A worry free, lovely stay. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The service at this hotel is better than any other hotel I have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: bistravelmississauga
Reviews.Content: This hotel has renovated the rooms over the last couple of years and they are so beautiful and comfortable - large screen TV and most comfortable bed and linens. But the best thing about this hotel is the fantastic service at the front desk and with everyone you come into contact.

Reviews.Title: “If you're a business traveler with a laptop -- AVOID!”
Reviews.Author: TheBeachShop
Reviews.Content: Average room is < $150. I've stayed at this hotel more than a half dozen times... always out of necessity. If I had a choice, I would avoid it. I've had a better rooms at more affordable prices at the airport (Aloft Montreal) or in the city (InterContinental Montreal). I share the following for the benefit of readers, and to hopefully put pressure on the hotel management to make reasonable changes where possible. SLOW INTERNET - Needs Broadband Simply inexcusable. Whether you're wireless or not, there are two versions of Internet at this hotel. For $7 per day, you can get slow @ 250 kbps download. (For you non-geeks, that's about 10% the speed of a cable modem -- and is not classified as broadband by the U.S. Federal Communications Commission.) Or you can choose the free SUPER slow @ 56 kbps dial up speed. It's really hard to tell the difference. Both are unbearable. If you're a business traveler who needs to work on a lap top, this is NOT a hotel for you. BAD DINING - Needs a Gordon Ramsey Overhaul The restaurants downstairs may look nice, but the food is awful. Trust me. Cafe dLux is really only good for morning coffee and pastries. Mahjongg Chinese Bistro is something even the front desk suggests you avoid. If you want Asian, you're better off walking a few blocks down to the Hot & Spicy. Other choices include Baton Rouge (the Canadian version of T.G.I. Fridays), which is a 10 min walk. Also, several greasy spoons and fast food joints are in walking distance. NO LATE NIGHT SNACKS - Needs vending with snacks It's really hard to believe. But this hotel has no vending machine or snacks anywhere on premise for late arrivals. Soda pop only. Need a cracker or bag of chips? The front desk will direct you to walk down the street. Not good when the weather is cold. FEW TV CHANNELS - Needs More US Channels While you do get an HDTV in your room, nearly half the channels are in French. And there is not a very wide selection. When I've stayed in the Caribbean or Mexico, I had more US channels than at Ruby Foo's. Not for the American traveler! CLIMATE CONTROL - Needs an HVAC upgrade Good luck getting your room a comfortable temperature. Upon arrival, the heat is usually cranked up to sauna levels. I blast the AC all night -- but I find it a struggle to keep the air at room temperature. FEW POWER OUTLETS - Needs more accessible power Not all. But MANY of the rooms have an odd arrangement that make it nearly impossible to plug in a device near the bed stand. So if you have a phone or portable alarm, it may have to stay in the bathroom or on the desk on the other side of your room. FREE/FULL PARKING - Needs to charge for conference parking There is a parking lot for which you need a free ticket to enter/exit. But if you're a guest coming in for a stay when a conference is being held, you may not find a spot. BAD LOCATION I stay in Montreal fairly regularly. While this hotel is bargain priced, it is on blvd. Decarie -- a $25 cab ride from the airport AND downtown. The road is raised above a highway. Crossing sides to reverse direction is quite an ordeal. Rush hour is always gridlock traffic, during which 15 min for 2 km is not uncommon.

Reviews.Title: “Not so far off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: jabburlingtonVT
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at Ruby Foo's while visiting relatives in Montreal. It is off a major highway, not located downtown or in Old Montreal, but it is a very short walk to a metro stop. We were in one of the renovated rooms and found it roomy and very comfortable. My husband, who lived in Montreal until very recently, was very impressed with Ruby Foo's. One could pay much more for a similar hotel room nearer to the tourist attractions. If you're not timid about using the metro, Ruby Foo's can provide very comfortable accommodations at a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “As long as you get a newly renovated room....”
Reviews.Author: YukonRoadKing
Reviews.Content: The newly remodeled king superior rooms in the hotel's 4 storey wing are large and well furnished. Comfortable bed, roomy bathroom, nice touches throughout. Large new lobby and very friendly and helpful front desk. Prices seemed reasonable with free parking and convenient location beside the Decarie Expressway. Most people staying here are on business in the area or visting friends and family in the nearby residential areas of Hampstead, Cote St-Luc or Snowdon. There are very few choices on this side of town. The Metro is very close if you don't want to drive downtown, and a few restaurants and fast food nearby. Across the street of course is that famous orange ball, Gibeau's Orange Julep, worthy of a pilgrimage for those who like to recall life in the 50's. Still great hot dogs , fries and Orange Julep. Great fun at night with the hot cars, motorcycles, etc. Worth the 5 minute drive down Decarie and north of Queen Mary Rd is the venerable and excellent Snowdon Deli. Save yourself the drive down to Schwartz's on Boul St-Laurent, unless you've never been to Schwartz's, in which case you have to go, line up outside, and experience it for yourself. If you're in the mood for some fancy shopping without going downtown, Ruby Foos is only about 10-15 minutes away from Rockland Shopping Centre. Get directions at the concierge. All the high end stores.

Reviews.Title: “You won't do better”
Reviews.Author: drhackenabush
Reviews.Content: I am there every month on business, with free parking & internet fully renovated rooms you can not do better for the price. If the weather is bad it is beside the metro so getting around is easy. The restaurants are good not great. But if you like Indian food the best in the city is at a litte family place around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Ruby Foo is A-OK”
Reviews.Author: EssenceTO
Reviews.Content: Went to Ruby Foo's on a group bus tour so it was an overnighter. Found the room to be clean and well maintained. The beds were comfortable. It is not too far out of the main swing of things in downtown Montreal and the staff were really helpful in providing us with directions and feedback on spots we should go to. Overall it was a short but pleasant stay. Loved the Asian inspired decor as which gave it a different spin. Can't commnent on the food as I did not eat at the hotel but they do appear to have a full service restaurant attached. It was good value for the money we paid for the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from the "standard rooms"”
Reviews.Author: BumblebeeVancouver
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel to attend a meeting. I can't talk much about the location as we drove in pretty late from Toronto and I was in the back seat so have no clue what the proximity is to downtown. There were a few restaurants in the area, including you usual fast food choice of McDonalds and Burger King and I noticed a metro station just a 1/2 block away. The outside of the hotel itself looked like you typical hotel/motel off the highway. A short 3 or 4 level building. We had booked a standard "non smoking room". When were on the 3rd floor via a tiny elevator at took forever to get to - located on one end of the bulding furthest away from the lobby. The elevator was tiny and could fit 4-5 people with luggage at best. Turns out the one within a few feet of the lobby was a much nicer elevator - larger and newer, which of course led to the more expensive rooms. When we entered the room we were hit with the stench of smoke. I checked another 2 rooms that my co-workers were in to see if it were any better... not only was it not better, there was an ashtray and matches on the coffee table in one of the rooms. I went to the front desk and asked for another room. First off, I was told that I was indeed in a smoking room. But when I confronted the clerk and said that my next door neighbour's room had an ashtray and matches, the agent seemed almost embarrassed and didn't have anything further to say, except perhaps housekeeping made a mistake putting it in the room. I was told that the hotel was "sold out" for the night at that there were no rooms available. I went back to the room and fumed about it (sorry for the pun) but after a few minutes of trying to air it out by turning on the air conditioning to full blast, made another attempt at the front desk. The second person I spoke with at the front desk was more apologetic but still said there wasn't anywhere he could move me to for the night. I said that from where I come from (Vancouver) all the good hotels would put up guests in another hotel if they were not able to provide what they promised. Secondly I also asked how many rooms they had and asked to confirm that all categories of rooms are sold out. (Coming from the industry, I am always hesitant to believe that hotels sell out.) To which he admitted that the standard room categories were sold out but they had superior rooms and that I'd have to pay more for these rooms. He mentioned that this happens all the time (which can't be a good sign). He asked my if I were allergic to smoke etc. At this time, I was pretty annoyed... I personally am not allergic to smoke but since I don't smoke and have a legal right to get a non smoking room, don't see why my so called non smoking room smells of smoke and that they felt that I had to pay more to get a non smoking one. It's almost like getting penalized for not being a smoker. To make a really really long story short... I did get another room, though they made me felt like they were doing me a favour by upgrading me to a deluxe room. Though the new room was nicer, I would have been fine sleeping in the standard room had it not smelled of smoke. If I happen to stay here again, knowing what I know, I would personally opt to pay for the difference in the room just to get a nicer room. BUT I still find that their pictures on the website of the standard rooms are a bit misleading (must have been taken many years ago) and that the service is questionable given the time and extremes I had to go to get a room that doesn't smell of smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Not as pictured = (”
Reviews.Author: Idzit
Reviews.Content: We booked a regular room with a Queen-size bed, on the non-smoking floor. The hotel has a very nice lobby, friendly service, free parking, but the room looks NOTHING like any of the pictures where the rooms look contemporary / asian fusion. The ones pictured are probably the higher-end rooms, and the pictures are QUITE deceiving. The room smelled a little smoky, the bed was SMALLER than a current standard Queen-sized bed. When I inquired to make sure they had given us the right room, they told us that the bed is older, and more modern Queen-sized beds are being built larger (in this case, they should have definitely advertised this room as having a double bed, because it is smaller). I liked the convenience of having a small fridge in the room, but I did not like the fact that there was no cold water running from the bathroom tap. I had to brush my teeth with hot water...

Reviews.Title: “Renovations are superb!”
Reviews.Author: pkane
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve stayed here about 10 times over the past 10 years. It was getting really run-down until recently when they made renovations. I just stayed here September 6th and was pleasantly surprised with the renovated lobby and rooms. I donâ€™t think all the rooms are renovated but definitely request to stay in one. It kind of reminded me of a small Vegas hotel room. Very nice asian inspired dÃ©cor. One thing I loved was the â€œcurtainsâ€�. Instead of curtains there is a sliding wall which perfectly blocks out the sun if you want to sleep in. Also, if you arenâ€™t staying downtown this is a perfect location. 2 minute walk to the metro. I ate lunch cafÃ© DLux which was very good. However, I attended a private party in the same restaurant that evening for 80 people and the food served was not too good. Dry chicken and very fishy salmon.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Ottawan
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Ruby Foo's for many years. I am an ex-Montrealer living in Ottawa, and I literally have lost count the number of times I've stayed at the property. The hotel is clean, modern, and recently renovated. It is very conveniently situated in mid-town, about 15 minutes from downtown (not in rush hour). There are excellent restaurants nearby. Parking is free and plentiful. On the other hand, it is NOT downtown and is not close to any tourist sights. That said, my trips to Montreal are to visit family who live in the immediate area. I hardly ever go downtown. If the prime purpose of your trip to Montreal is to sightseeing, it is inconveniently located. You would be much better downtown.

Reviews.Title: “A Winner!”
Reviews.Author: Saraheskin
Reviews.Content: I must say that after reading some of the reviews before the renovation I was reluctant to book at this hotel. Because of the great location-and free parking - I took a chance and reserved a room anyway. What a great decision! First impression: the lobby is remarkable. Check-in was efficient and fast. My beautifully renovated room was impeccable (and Iâ€™m very picky). Staff is courteous and really helpful. And the recently opened new restaurant was great â€“ a fitting re-launch of Montrealâ€™s famous Ruby Fooâ€™s restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel - vastly underrated”
Reviews.Author: estragon
Reviews.Content: I booked a stay at Ruby Foo's entirely for the convenience: it's on Decarie, just a few blocks from Hwy 40, so it's perfect if you need to get around Montreal quickly or get out of town. But I ended up being extremely impressed by the hotel itself. It's just finishing up a top-to-bottom renovation, and the rooms and facilities are uniformly excellent. My room had an super-comfortable king-size bed, a spotless, good sized bathroom, a large flat-screen TV, excellent lighting, and a comfortable work space. The rooms were clearly intelligently designed: even the light switches are in all the right places. The lobby is clean and spacious, there is lots of free parking (though it is outdoors), and the staff are uniformly friendly and helpful. There are a few touches that would put Ruby Foo's over the top: a phone by the bed would be nice, and I'm told wireless internet is coming soon. For now, an Ethernet cable is provided. It worked well for me, but I prefer to be able to choose where I work on my laptop. Finally, the only sign of amateurish service was over breakfast. The waitstaff appeared to be poorly trained, slow, and a bit clueless. Some days it took ten minutes for them to take our order, refills were inconsistent, and the one time my colleague wanted to send something back, the waiter picked an argument with him. Overall, though, our stay at Ruby Foo's was exceptional, and I would gladly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Our group stayed at Ruby Foos, Group rate was done by Hotel Wars.ca”
Reviews.Author: GFunfunfun7777
Reviews.Content: We booked our group with Hotel Wars, which was not listed as an option on this site. The company got us 20 bids and we choose ruby foos. The hotel was really close to our MTL office and it is four stars. The service was fine and the food was worth the price. The thing is because we didnt book with Expedia hotels.ca or orbitz, we did not have to pay commission. Hotels are forced to keep the rate high when their is a third party. Hotel Wars.ca does not take commissions. The price was really good. And the hotel was a perfect 5/5. I will go back and refer Ruby Foos to any and all.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: cakmph
Reviews.Content: We overnighted at this hotel enroute to a wedding. We found the staff to be amazing. They were extremely helpful, spending a considerable amount of time locating directions to a wedding ceremony and reception. The room was clean and it worked for our purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Oh Hell No”
Reviews.Author: SandyM348383Toronto
Reviews.Content: Okay. Would I return here. No thanks. This hotel looks all that but once you get in, no free breakfast, they charge extra for everything. In the end, my dad nearly flipped out on the front desk guy. The bill was closer to $200 smackers and that was one night stay in Montreal. We are going to try another hotel should we be back in town for another netball game. I mean, no loyalty points and anyways. I could go on for hours. They do have nice childrens furniture. Too bad they are supposed to be regular sizes. Not kidding. They have kids stuff doubling as regular sized stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Ruby Blues - Can't Recommend”
Reviews.Author: reclermo
Reviews.Content: I left my booking for my last trip to Montreal up to a business partner who followed the advice of a local company which had a corporate rate at Ruby Foo's. I was rather optimistic about my stay here because Montreal has a fine reputation for smaller less well known hotels offering high levels of comfort and service. I was under the impression that the Ruby would fall into the boutique hotel mold; however, I was sorely mistaken. The hotel is quite simply an average 2*. The rooms were outdated, the beds were uncomfortable and the service was unfriendly. The area has an industrial feel to it and is unsuitable for nightly walks or shopping. We did try the Sushi restaurant one evening and found that the food and service lived up to the general quality level of the hotel, which was not great. The one upside is that the hotel has a great breakfast restaurant and the service was quite good. My food in the morning almost made me forget about my sub par room experience the evening prior. The only reason to stay here is if you are doing business at a local company and require a hotel that is close for an early morning meeting. Otherwise, I would suggest another option, especially if you have good taste and appreciate 3* hotels that live up to their ratings (Marriott).

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't even take a professional escort here. No service no refund?”
Reviews.Author: Home777
Reviews.Content: I am not picky, but this is the last time I book at a non brand hotel. I usually try to stay downtown, but my friend told me that Ruby Foo is reasonable. I gave it a try and will not be going back. I was checked into a room that was already occupied and then when I told the front desk, they asked me for my ID? They then checked me into the wrong room type and refused to give me and my friend two beds. We got 1 king for two 50 year old men? I woudnt have minded, if the room didnt have the childrens desk. I felt like I was in Viet Nam. (during the war). The party in the hallway kept me up most the night and in the morning we missed our wake up call becasue the phone was unplugged so my buddy missed his 6 AM flight at Pierre Elloitt Airport. The front desk guy didnt even say sorry when I asked for a rebate or refund. He said speak with the manager and transferred me to voicemail. I checked into the Sheraton on Cote de Liesse but they were soldout the next night. I then moved to the Quality on Decarie and they were both fine. I was seriously disappointed at Ruby Foo.

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: sam123456
Reviews.Content: didn't end up staying at this hotel. I had heard good things aobut it and thought it was rated 4 stars. Definitely not. I would give it 2 stars. Rooms were barren, basic, a/c didn't work well and room looked unclean. I found manager unhelpful and some of the staff rude. We ended up not staying and went to Sheraton Airport. Although that hotel was a bit out of the way, staff there were wonderful, rooms were great and kids loved their waterslide. Ruby Foos would not be my choice for a hotel to stay at if you want to throughly enjoy the holiday. Sheraton was $10 cheaper and had an indoor pool with waterslide. Ruby Foos, - overpriced, staff rude, rooms very basic and not exceptionally clean. Forget the convenience and stay elsewhere. The decor dark and weird; - long halls to walk especially with children.

Reviews.Title: “What a Rip Off!”
Reviews.Author: openlove
Reviews.Content: Customer service does NOT make Americans feel welcome.They "snicker" as soon as your back is turned. Prices for EVERYTHING there is WAY TOO HIGH. The internet connection never worked,either did the air conditioning. Housekeeping just walked right on into your room even when the "do not disturb" sign was on the door. I even called the manager of the hotel explaining all of this..and more, with NO reply at all! THEY DONT CARE! I would NOT recommend anyones stay.I will NOT be back there...EVER!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Decent, Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Coolcanuck2
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in early June, 2006. The hotel in my view is a perfectly fine, average 3 star hotel. No bells and whistles, or anything special about it, but it's clean and relatively up to date. A bonus (at least for me) was the free parking, with unlimited in and out priveleges. It's also right near the Decarie Expressway which allows for getting in (or leaving) the city painlessly. My room was spacious, plain and quite clean and had been refreshed not that long ago. The bed and furniture were just fine. Unlike one of the previous reviews, there was nothing old, dirty, saggy or noisy about the place at all. Check-in and check-out were quick and painless. Overall, a fine, basic, clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's not *that* bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had pretty low expectations based on these reviews, but itâ€™s really a decent hotel. The fact is it's the closest hotel with free parking to downtown (15 min drive) at budget price. This is good if you have a car. Otherwise look closer downtown. With regards to "Dirty furniture" "saggy bed" "runny toilet" "hot room"... these claims are unfounded in my experience. With regards to "dated look" and "no update since the 60's" also seem unfounded. The bathroom is totally updated, the contents of hotel room looked early 90's... it's totally on par with any hotel in this price range Iâ€™ve been in (in the upper Midwest US or southern US) within the last year. If you want a class, I suggest you increase your budget, and find something downtown.

Reviews.Title: “bad Hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to Montreal for family business. I stayed at the Ruby Foo's Hotel,I had a horrible experience. The check in was delayed due to a untrained clerk. Once I funally checked in I was forced to walk for 10 minutes until I finally found my room. The room was hot and smelly. The furniture was not well taken care of. I would not stay here again. A little further down Decarie Blvd there is a nice Quality Hotel. I plan on trying that Hotel next time I come to Montreal

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, service and dining”
Reviews.Author: JoshThePilot
Reviews.Content: I do not see what people do not like about this place. We have been staying here for at least 10-12 years and the place is great. Just make sure to ask for a room in the newer wing. The decor is asian themed and there is a restaurant on premises which serves several types of food in 1 dining room. Location is great since it is close to main roads and the metro subway system. Rooms are always clean and made up by the time you get back in the afternoon. Stay here if you want easy access to the city. Do not stay if you except luxury and pampering. Front desk staff go out of their way to help you including researching restaurants and attractions in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dated-1960's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Hotel(should be Motel) is way overpriced for the poor condition that the place is in.Our room had a double bed that was worn out,saggy and lumpy.The toilet ran on all the time.It looked like it hadn't been updated since the 60's. Teenagers were running up and down the halls late at night making noise.Staff didn't keep a close enough eye on them after complaints. Restaurant was okay but overpriced.I can't believe that the CAA recommended them.This was based on my visit in 1997.It's obvious from the more updated comments that nothing has changed and the owners don't care about making the place nice enough to justify the price they are charging. Needless to say,the next time I'm in Montreal,I won't be staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Not value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rate was well over-priced. Paid >$500 for two nights on line but was shocked when arrived to see the condition of the hotel outside and the room inside.

Reviews.Title: “Stuck in Montreal with no room reservation”
Reviews.Author: OutsideNycStevie
Reviews.Content: Just had the opportunity to visit Montreal with a friend recently; unfortunately, we did not make any reservation prior and did not know that the Formula One race circuit was in town then. As it turned out, the only hotel with air conditioning (somehow, it was over 90 degrees) was Ruby Foo's. The website made this proeperty out to be a little better than it really was. The positives for Ruby Foo's- near the metro, just off Hwy 15, close to airport, clean bed. The negatives for Ruby Foo's- pool closed, parking lot and entrance is a very dusty construction zone, rooms are dark and very noisy, in a questionable neighborhood, close to Hwy 15's terrible traffic, no cocktail lounge, rooms are kind of tired Howard Johnson-style. I can only blame myself for the situation of having to stay there and, if I returned, would receive a discount due to the renovation. However, it is most unlikely that I will ever visit Ruby Foo's again. Loved Montreal and will certainly return there. I have stayed in much worse than Ruby Foo's; once all their promised renovations are complete, this might be a touch better. My next stay will be at the Vogue or W.

Reviews.Title: “Motel in Disguise”
Reviews.Author: CarolefromCanada
Reviews.Content: Was forced by the company I was working for to stay at Ruby Foo's many times. It is nothing more than a converted motel, stuck out in a working class neighbourhood. Food is expensive and mediocre. They were trying to pass themselves off as a boutique hotel but I complained and luckily that status was recinded by Boutique Hotels International. Tacky is the word that first comes to mind.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ruby Foo's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel. The rooms were recently redecorated and are quite lovely. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful! The area has developped recently, with many restaurants and shopping outlets. A major bonus is that the parking is free, and you can take the subway to downtown Montreal ( Way cheaper than paying for downtown parking!!) A beautiful new spa and fully equipped gym are on site in the hotel. I must have gained 5 pounds eating at one of the restaurants (La Tulipe Noire) The cheesecake and pastries are to die for! If you enjoy sushi, you have found the ideal spot. This hotel is really convenient because of it's location (close to Airport, and downtown). A real treasure! All in all, I would denifitely return to this hotel, and would recommend it to anyone who is looking good quality versus value.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ruby Foo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pro's Cheap place to stay. Close to Metro. Close to Dorval Airport Con's Nothing cool is in walking distance. Restaurant food quality for everything except sushi is horrible. Restaurant service, particularly the bar is not existent. On a week night expect to have to harass the hotel to keep the bar open past 11:00 PM. Last call in Montreal is btwn 2:00 and 3:00 AM. Condition of rooms is VERY poor. Fortunate are decor is very dated. Thermostat in your room may or may not work; it goes for the taps in the bathroom. Have never stayed at such a poor quality hotel! Would choose a best western over this place any day.
